item.title: Update 1.3.2.8 is live!
item.description:
Lord Captains!

Update 1.3.2.8 is live, solving the issues with Marazhai‚Äôs romance, bringing you fixes for a number of desync issues, localization fixes, and adding Turkish localization on consoles and for Void Shadows DLC.

Note that https://steamcommunity.com/app/2186680/discussions/0/4027970580228219058/ always contains up-to-date information on known issues and the roadmap of upcoming patches.

Patch notes:

System and stability

  • Some cutscenes could freeze the game when skipped - fixed;

Narrative

  • Fixed an issue where Abel sometimes did not join the Lord Captain in the Let the Cycle Be Discontinued Pasqal‚Äôs quest, which could break multiple cutscenes;
  • Restored a few missing options in Marazhai‚Äôs romance dialogues that mysteriously disappeared after patch 1.3, preventing one of the endings from being reached;

Mechanics
  • Fixed the description for Bounty Hunter‚Äôs Hot on the Trail ability to be consistent with the actual bonus;

Items

  • Thought Guide‚Äôs Will bonus is now correctly reflected in its description;
  • Blooddrinking Staff‚Äôs Will bonus is now correctly reflected in its description;
  • Astartes Chainsword‚Äôs description no longer duplicates itself;
  • Noble Sword had an incorrect description that didn‚Äôt match its actual stats - fixed;

Locations

  • Fixed the hitbox of Occluding Sphere at the Inquisition Shipwreck, which could cause pathing issues;
  • Fixed a broken cutscene at Santiel‚Äôs pride;
  • Fixed a few unreachable overtips at Santiel‚Äôs pride;

Co-op

  • Fixed a number of desyncs caused by Bring it Down ability;
  • Fixed a number of desyncs caused by Vanguard abilities;

Audio

  • Improved sound effects and music in multiple cutscenes;

Localization

  • Turkish localization is now available on consoles;
  • Void Shadows DLC is now also available in Turkish;
  • Fixed font issues with some special characters for multiple languages including Turkish;
  • A lot of minor localization fixes in all languages: typos, formatting, incorrect tags, ‚Äú[draft]‚Äù text, term inconsistencies etc.;
  • Fixed a lot of missing and incorrect glossary links;
  • Some Eurac-V item descriptions didn‚Äôt have any translation other than English and Russian - fixed;
  • Champion of the Abyss buff had an incorrect description in Russian - fixed;

item.title: Hotfix 6.1
item.description:
Hello Space Marines,

We deployed a hotfix on Space Marine 2 that fixes issues that appeared with the 6.0 update, mainly connectivity issues, but also adding the Salamander emblem on the right shoulder pad.

If you encounter issues with this update, let us know by making a bug report here.

You'll find the complete patch notes down below.

Patch Notes
  • Fixed several crashes
  • Fixed various connectivity issues
  • Fixed issue with Biovore spawned mines being unkillable in a rare case
  • Fixed issue with modded games being locked to offline mode
  • Fixed Unyielding Ceramite perk deleting armour gained from Armour Boost
  • Fixed Volkite VFX not playing correctly on Biovore
  • Fixed music getting stuck in PvP matches
  • Added missing Salamanders emblem on right shoulder pad
  • Minor localization fixes

item.title: Total War: WARHAMMER III Improving AI in Campaign
item.description:
Hey Folks,

At the tail end of last year, you saw us run a few of our Hotfixes out for Total War: WARHAMMER III via the Beta function on Steam. This was invaluable for our teams as we readied some necessary game updates during the rollout of Omens of Destruction, and helped us catch some last minute feedback from you and ensure our updates were on point. Whilst we haven‚Äôt needed to pull on that lever quite so much since we got back into the swing of things in 2025, it has encouraged us to think about even more ways that we can involve you in some of our more complex game changes, and work closer with you all to bring more improvements to the game.

To that end, tomorrow (February 13th) we will launch a new public Beta Branch for Total War: WARHAMMER III via Steam. This Beta will allow you to experience and provide feedback on the latest improvements to our Campaign AI, where your insights and experiences will help us refine and enhance the game. To understand what changes we‚Äôre making, you‚Äôll read about all of the science from Principal Technical Designer Radoslav Borisov down below, and if you check back on this post tomorrow, you‚Äôll find detailed instructions on how to access the Beta at the foot of this post.

We‚Äôll run this Beta for around two weeks initially, bringing it to a close around February the 26th. It‚Äôll be running on a modified version of the live game that you‚Äôre already playing today, so this Beta won‚Äôt be used to test any additional upcoming changes to the wider game, and we‚Äôll be encouraging folks to start fresh Campaigns for this test in order to check best on how our changes are performing.

Tomorrow, we‚Äôll be opening a new sub-forum over on the Total War Forums to gather your feedback on the Campaign AI fixes and improvements that we‚Äôre looking to make, alongside a survey that will run throughout the Beta that will invite players to share their feedback directly with us. We‚Äôll post that survey link in the news feed of the Beta version of the game itself, but if you check back tomorrow, we‚Äôll have updated our posts so that you‚Äôll have direct access to it on your other devices, in case you‚Äôre looking to complete it after spending more time with your thoughts.

At the conclusion of this first Beta at the end of February, we‚Äôll comb through all of your feedback, pour over the data our side, and come back to you to talk more about where we‚Äôll be looking to make improvements and to bring further changes. If all goes well, we‚Äôre planning a second round of testing with an updated Beta sometime later in the Spring. Please keep in mind that this is our goal, and to expect direct comms from us if this timeframe has to shift. Campaign AI improvement is a big, and complex topic, and our goal is to break it down into smaller pieces and address them with player feedback front of mind so we can deliver improvements that you want in a sustainable way.

To those who do look to get involved, thank you in advance for your participation in this Beta!
